definition: to stand aloof/to be detached from/to transcend worldliness/untrammeled/unconventional
to exceed/to overtake/to surpass/to transcend/to pass/to cross/ultra-/super-
to shed/to take off/to escape/to get away from

sentences.english: I was reminded of my friends and their need to stay detached.
sentences.chinese: 我想起了我的朋友和他們的保持超脫。

sentences.english: And, dying, it rises above its own agony to outcarol the lark and the nightingale.
sentences.chinese: 它超脫了垂死的劇痛，歌聲勝過百靈和夜鶯。
超脫是純粹的，是純真無邪。

sentences.english: Open-minded religions Kuang large, detached spirit of this world.
sentences.chinese: 宗教有襟懷曠大，超脫現世之精神。

sentences.english: If the poem is more of a fairy-like detachment from worldly elegant.
sentences.chinese: 詩中更有一種如仙般超脫塵世的飄逸。

sentences.english: Freedom will be a kind of grace when it breaks away from the busy world.
sentences.chinese: 超脫了煩囂的世界，自由便是一種風度。

sentences.english: Yet only the economic in the narrow sense will allow usto get beyond the economic.
sentences.chinese: 目前只有在狹義的經濟學中允許我們超脫於經濟學。

sentences.english: Detach and simplify and you minimize worry.
sentences.chinese: 超脫與精簡能夠最小化你的擔憂。

sentences.english: Aesthetic education can influence man because of its universality and unconventionality .
sentences.chinese: 美育對人能發生作用在於關具有普遍性和超脫性。

sentences.english: Knowing this, we would be free from money.
sentences.chinese: 看清楚這一點就能夠從金錢中超脫。

sentences.english: Who can really sad is all detached view and enjoy life?
sentences.chinese: 誰又能夠真的正超脫所有的悲與歡來看待浮生呢？

sentences.english: He sits completely still, contemplating the nature of reality, free even of his own body.
sentences.chinese: 聖人打坐，冥想着現實的本質，超脫於肉身的拖累。

sentences.english: You cannot be saved from the world, but you can escape from its cause.
sentences.chinese: 你無法超脫這個世界，可是你卻能逃離它的肇因。

sentences.english: Some people find happiness in escaping the seesaw of fleeting gains and losses.
sentences.chinese: 有人在超脫得失之後找到了幸福。

definition: to sublimate/sublimation (physics)/to raise to a higher level/to refine/promotion
to return to one's true self/to regain the natural state
